bibl.title: Architectural Typology of Historic Coptic Churches from Oxyrhynchos to Dayr al-Ganadla.
bibl.note: Churches with Domed Nave. - Churches with Nave Roofed with a Combination of Domes and Vaults. - Churches with Square Nave. - Transverse Churches. - Basilican-plan Churches. - Basilican-plan Churches with Triconch Sanctuary. - Basilican-plan Churches with Transepts (Cruciform Plan). - The Ruined Churches of Manqabad. - Pp. 336-338: Appendix: Historic Monasteries and Churches of Middle Egypt from Oxyrhynchos to Dayr al-Ganadla.

bibl.title: Christianity and Monasticism in Middle Egypt. Al-Minya and Asyut.

bibl.seg: Sami Sabri Shaker, Architectural Typology of Historic Coptic Churches from Oxyrhynchos to Dayr al-Ganadla.
Gawdat Gabra & Hany N. Takla (edd.), Christianity and Monasticism in Middle Egypt. Al-Minya and Asyut (Cairo - New York, 2015) pp. 321-338, 33 figg.

Churches with Domed Nave. - Churches with Nave Roofed with a Combination of Domes and Vaults. - Churches with Square Nave. - Transverse Churches. - Basilican-plan Churches. - Basilican-plan Churches with Triconch Sanctuary. - Basilican-plan Churches with Transepts (Cruciform Plan). - The Ruined Churches of Manqabad. - Pp. 336-338: Appendix: Historic Monasteries and Churches of Middle Egypt from Oxyrhynchos to Dayr al-Ganadla.
